content.description: Squat start with the left hand in a small pocket and the right on a crimp above the hueco to the right. Set a heel-toe lock in the right hueco. Slap around and pull up to better holds above, either left or (better), right to the finish of Death Star 2000.
content.location: East face of the boulder. From Anti-Hero, keep walking to the other side of the boulder until you see the heavily chalked pocket and shallow huecos a few feet from the ground.

content.description: I thought this was way fun... Begin low low down in the cave and climb out through the split on huge jugs, to smaller but good holds below the lip, then to the lip itself, and traverse right to top out. A heel-toe cam at the roof is not necessary but adds some style points. Falling off the end might result in an unpleasant ping-ponging trip down to your crash pads.
content.protection: A couple pads and spotter. The ending could be dangerous if you're not careful.
content.location: Just down from the Death Star Cave this lone problem climbs out of the obvious pit on the stacked boulders.

content.description: Start with a low sit start, with one hand in an undercling and one in a pocket (The Evil Eye).  Pull hard to get off the ground and slap for the lip.  Match on slopers and continue up to an easier top out.
content.location: About 10 feet right of "Anti-Hero".  Starts on the next boulder right of "Anti-Hero"

content.description: Another cool thuggy lowball. Begin at slopey huecos a couple feet off the ground and, using a kneebar if you please, slap out sloping but textured crimps with great difficulty to reach a decent hold out left, then stand up into the scoop without too much trouble. Burly!
content.location: On the right side of the Death Star Cave, almost out into the daylight, look for the low slopey huecos and the sweet crimps.

content.description: Classic moves: start with your ass way down in the dirt, left hand absurdly low on the arete and right on a good sidepull or undercling. Power out the steep overhang with positive flakes, underclings, kneebars, toehooks, and brute force to slopey-ish holds at the lip, then find the good flake out left to top out easily. This would for sure get four stars except for the extreme dab potential on the rock a few inches below your rear. And it'll probably feel easy at the grade if you do a lot of pullups.
content.protection: Pads and spotter, or ditch the pads to give yourself a few inches, falling on the rock probably wouldn't hurt THAT bad...
content.location: On the left side of the Death Star Cave, climb from a sit, straight up through the awesome undercling feature.
